author: Special Correspondent
text:
A section of the students, who participated in the short term course on ‘animal experimentation in nutrition’ organised by the Department of Food Science and Nutrition of Periyar University.

The three-day short term course on ‘animal experimentation in nutrition’ organised by the Department of Food Science and Nutrition of Periyar University concluded on Friday.

Experts from different fields described in detail onintroduction to animal experiments, nutritional bioassay, animal experimentation designs, selection of animals, animal handling techniques, animal feeding process, safety and precautions, risk management, various routes of sample injection and blood sample collection, parameters to be assessed for best interpretation of results and animal ethical issues and regulations to enhance the student’s skill on animal experimentation in nutrition. C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, Periyar University, pointed out that animal testing remains a mandatory process and a very detailed skill based course on animal experimentation is needed for the Life Science discipline students, since non-animal models in biomedical research are yet to be established.

G. Archunan, Professor and Head, Department of Animal Science, Bharathidasan University, Tiruchi and K. Vasudevan, Associate Professor in Zoology, DDE-Zoology wing, Annamalai University, handled the sessions.
title: Short-term course on ‘animal experimentation in nutrition’
